file_insights.changes: Extended transitions token object with Material-UI compatible values
file_insights.previous_structure: Simple convenience values (fast, normal, slow) with combined duration and easing
file_insights.new_structure: Added nested duration and easing objects following Material-UI conventions

patterns_discovered.description: Added duration values following Material-UI naming: shortest, shorter, short, standard, complex, enteringScreen, leavingScreen
patterns_discovered.significance: Provides standardized timing values for component animations matching Material-UI specifications

patterns_discovered.description: Four standard easing curves defined as cubic-bezier() functions
patterns_discovered.significance: Matches Material-UI's easing system for consistent motion across UI components

patterns_discovered.description: Preserved original convenience values (fast, normal, slow) while adding new nested structure
patterns_discovered.significance: Allows existing code to continue working while new code can use more granular Material-UI values

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Timing value inconsistency between Material-UI defaults and existing convenience values
gotchas_discovered.details: Original 'fast' (150ms) matches shortest duration, but 'normal' (200ms) differs from Material-UI standard (300ms)
gotchas_discovered.impact: Potential confusion about which duration values to use in new components
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Clear separation with comments and consistent naming conventions

gotchas_discovered.details: enteringScreen (225ms) and leavingScreen (195ms) have different values
gotchas_discovered.impact: Must use correct duration based on animation direction to match Material-UI expectations
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Descriptive property names make intent clear

approach_outcome.strategy: Extended existing token structure with Material-UI compatibility layer
approach_outcome.execution: Added duration and easing sub-objects to transitions token while preserving existing convenience values
approach_outcome.completeness: Fully implemented Material-UI compatible duration and easing systems
approach_outcome.effort_efficiency: Single-file modification with minimal code changes and no breaking changes

recommendations.recommendation: Add inline comments or documentation clarifying when to use convenience values vs. explicit duration/easing combination
recommendations.rationale: Developers may be unclear whether to use fast/normal/slow or duration + easing separately

recommendations.recommendation: Verify that Material-UI theme configuration properly references these duration and easing values
recommendations.rationale: Ensures tokens are actually used by Material-UI components instead of their defaults

recommendations.recommendation: Consider creating TypeScript types/interfaces for the transitions token structure
recommendations.rationale: Provides IDE autocomplete and prevents runtime errors when accessing duration/easing values

recommendations.recommendation: Add tests verifying that cubic-bezier values match Material-UI specifications
recommendations.rationale: Ensures easing curves produce expected motion characteristics
